intro: Machaeranthera venusta, commonly known as the showy blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features striking, bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Machaeranthera venusta is often found in prairies and open woodlands, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils.
